results.title: Morning glory
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Lowell Sherman
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn collected her first Academy Award for her masterful performance in “Morning glory”. Cast to type as a garrulous New Englander who arrives in New York with one burning ambition - to be an actress - she delivered an effervescent performance. Based on the play by Zoe Akins.

results.title: Morgan Stewart's coming home
results.creator_credit: Kings Road Entertainment, Stephen J. Friedman and Alan Smithee
results.brief_description: For the first time since he was a young boy, teenager Morgan Stewart (Jon Cryer) is invited by his parents to make the move from boarding school to home. Packing up his dorm room, Morgan sets out with high hopes that are swiftly quashed as it becomes apparent that his parents invited him home as a political move, eager to impress voters with the “family” push. When he meets the down to earth and wrong side of the tracks girl, Emily (Viveka Davis), Morgan is forced to choose between pursuing his own interests and maintaining the awkward sense of family. In the process Morgan discovers corruption by his father’s campaign press secretary (Paul Gleason) which also challenges his sense of familial loyalty. Cast also includes Nicholas Pryor and Lynn Redgrave.

results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.

results.title: More than words: cartoons
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Peter Baroutis and Chris Langman
results.brief_description: More than words is a series which follows Rosa, a young girl, and her friend, a little green creature from another planet. Using Rosa’s imagination, they explore the English language in different circumstances through a number of different texts. In this episode Rosa and the creature explore cartoons and how they are produced. When the little creature believes that cartoon events can translate into real life, Rosa sets out to show him this isn’t the case. They contact a cartoonist who, using current popular cartoons such as “The Simpsons” and “The Flintstones” as examples, explains the characteristics of cartoons, cartoon stereotypes, the basic formula for a storyline, the role music and sound effects play in creating an effective cartoon, and the way cartoon violence cannot translate into actual day activities.

results.title: More than words (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss Productions, Henry Strauss and Marvin Dreyer
results.brief_description: Describes some simple techniques for good communication, to the end that people may know where they stand with one another. Illustrates how failure to give clear instructions can cause misunderstandings, trouble and dissatisfaction to those receiving the instructions.

results.title: More than just trees
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: On his income as an independent woodcutter, Bill Mosher of Charlotte County, New Brunswick, was able to bring up a family of five sons. Some of them have chosen to earn their living in the same way, but they are having a difficult time competing with the large pulp and paper corporations they supply. Today, corporate forestry controls the market. This film describes the situation in New Brunswick, and the steps that are being taken by the independent wood producers to counteract the power of the eleven companies that control the pulp and paper industry.

results.title: More than just play = Tobb mint jatek (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Serious dedicated attention is characteristic of the play activity of a well balanced happy infant or child. Filmed in the Loczy Institute, the film shows how varied persevering and concentrated the activity of even the youngest baby can be if his play space affords the opportunity for many kinds of motor activity, and his play things are well chosen.

results.title: More than fair
results.creator_credit: Unesco, Jean Cavel and Francine Vande Wiele
results.brief_description: A survey of the status of women today (1970) and yesterday and of what the future must hold. Women, “the weaker sex”, it is said, are intended by nature to look decorative, to rear children and to look after their husbands and homes, but they also represent a powerhouse of intelligence, creative energy and practical realism which society needs today more than ever before. Commentator: Rex Keating.

results.title: More than blood and bandages
results.creator_credit: Slater Studios, South Australian Film Corporation, Nicholas Cockram and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description: A documentary designed to make the public aware of the variety of activities in which the Red Cross is involved. Shows the Red Cross responding to the needs of the sick, the handicapped, the disabled and the distressed.
